title: Himi 569
lyrics:
6 laui 6
(I Sione 3:2,3)
1.
Vakai ‘a e ‘ofa lahi
‘A si’etau Tamai;
‘A ‘ene fakahā
Ki ha kau angahala,
‘E ui pe tokua
Ko e fānau ‘a e ‘Otua.
2.
Hako he Tāpuhā
Kitaua ē mousa’a!
Tā ko e toki mana
Ko e ‘uli kuo ma’a!
Ha tala ka fungani,
Ko hai ‘e tui ki ai?
3.
Tala he Laumālie,
‘Oku mo’oni pē.
Ko hotau fakama’a
Kuo fai he Ta’ata’a;
‘O ohi ’e he ‘Eiki
Ki hono fāmili.
4.
Kuo te’eki hā
‘A e me’a te tau a’usia:
Kae lahi ‘a e lelei
‘Oku tau ‘ilo heni;
‘O ma’u ha konga si’i
‘O hono ‘īmisi.
5.
Kae huanoa ka fai
‘Etau femātaaki:
Hā hono anga tonu
‘O sio ta’epūlou:
Toki liliu ai au
‘O u ma’u hono tatau.*
Origins of this hymn
